questions.question_text: A steering committee has been advised by the IT project management office that individual business units are building systems components that could be leveraged by other business units. Instead, identical components are being duplicated across the enterprise. Which of the following committee directives would be the BEST way to reduce the likelihood of this duplication?

choices.D: Review IT system release management practices.
choices.A: Implement stage gate reviews to assess systems.
choices.C: Perform an assessment of change management processes.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
By having a well-defined enterprise architecture in place, the organization can promote reusability of components, reduce duplication, and ensure consistency and interoperability across business units.

Selected Answer: B
B. Establish an enterprise architecture.

The BEST way to reduce the likelihood of duplication of systems components across business units is to establish an enterprise architecture (Option B). An enterprise architecture provides a structured framework for managing and aligning IT resources with business goals. It includes guidelines and standards for designing and implementing systems, ensuring that components are reusable and shared across the organization.

Selected Answer: C
C. Ensuring solution providers and their IoT use cases have been researched

When incorporating an Internet of Things (IoT) component in the IT strategy for the enterprise's digital transformation, the FIRST consideration should be to ensure solution providers and their IoT use cases have been researched (Option C). Understanding the capabilities of different solution providers and evaluating their use cases helps the CIO make informed decisions about the technology that aligns with the organization's goals and requirements.

This research includes examining available IoT solutions, assessing their compatibility with the existing IT infrastructure, and understanding how these solutions can contribute to the digital transformation objectives. It's important to gather information on potential vendors, their track records, and the applicability of their IoT solutions to the enterprise's specific needs before moving forward with the integration of IoT into the IT strategy.

questions.question_text: To support the enterprise's digital transformation, the CIO has been asked to include an Internet of Things (IoT) component in the IT strategy. Which of the following should be the FIRST consideration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
An enterprise may accept IT risk that exceeds its usual risk appetite if compliance with local regulations necessitates it. Legal and regulatory requirements often override internal risk policies, as failure to comply could result in legal penalties, financial loss, or operational restrictions. Technical gap disparities should be mitigated rather than accepted as a justification for increased risk. The answer is D.

questions.question_text: A retail enterprise wants to leverage emerging technologies to create a new sales channel for its customers. However, IT has little experience with these technologies and is unsure if the proposed schedule can be met. Which of the following will BEST help to determine IT's ability to meet this need?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Conducting a resource gap assessment

To determine IT's ability to meet the need of leveraging emerging technologies for a new sales channel, the BEST approach is to conduct a resource gap assessment (Option A). This assessment involves evaluating the current skills, capabilities, and resources within the IT department against the requirements of the proposed project. It helps identify any gaps in expertise or resources that may need to be addressed to successfully implement the new sales channel.
